learningObjectives.text: Synthesize research findings and stakeholder input into actionable process improvement recommendations

traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Develop a prioritized implementation roadmap considering organizational constraints and change management

traceability.studentGoal: Understand how organizations use data to make decisions
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Apply disciplinary knowledge to solve real-world problems

learningObjectives.text: Demonstrate professional consulting behaviors including client communication and project management

traceability.studentGoal: Build confidence communicating with senior professionals
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Collaborate effectively with professionals and stakeholders

learningObjectives.text: Reflect on professional identity development in consulting and organizational development contexts

traceability.studentGoal: Explore applications of psychology in business settings
traceability.institutionalOutcome: Reflect critically on personal and professional development

objectives: Understand organizational context and consulting engagement

activities.description: Meet with Operations Manager for project kickoff and context
Review existing onboarding documentation and materials
Reflect on consulting role and initial organizational observations
Read: Introduction to process improvement and consulting methodologies
Draft project approach and stakeholder engagement plan

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you learn about the organization and its onboarding challenges? Who are the key stakeholders you'll be working with?
dealReflection.examine: How does the consulting context differ from academic research? What organizational behavior concepts seem relevant to this situation?
dealReflection.articulate: Anna, what consulting and research skills do you expect to apply? What new skills might you need to develop?

activities.description: Shadow and document current onboarding activities
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss observations
Read: Process mapping techniques and documentation methods
Create initial process flow diagram

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what did you observe about the current onboarding process? What documentation methods did you use?
dealReflection.examine: How do organizational structures and culture influence process design? What concepts from Organizational Behavior help explain what you're seeing?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about translating observations into systematic documentation? How might this skill transfer to future work?

activities.description: Design semi-structured interview protocol
Pilot interview with Operations Manager for feedback
Read: Qualitative research methods and interview techniques
Refine protocol and begin stakeholder interviews

dealReflection.describe: How did you design your interview protocol? What considerations shaped your approach?
dealReflection.examine: How do research methods skills from psychology apply in consulting contexts? What ethical considerations guide stakeholder interviews?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about gathering qualitative data in organizations? How does this connect to your research methods training?

activities.description: Conduct remaining stakeholder interviews
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss interview insights
Read: Thematic analysis and qualitative data synthesis
Complete process map and begin coding interview data

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what themes are emerging from your interviews? What patterns do you see across stakeholders?
dealReflection.examine: How do individual perspectives vary based on role and position? What organizational psychology concepts help explain these differences?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about synthesizing diverse stakeholder perspectives? How does this relate to concepts from your coursework?

objectives: Identify key pain points and opportunities

activities.description: Complete coding and thematic analysis of interview data
Validate themes with select stakeholders
Read: Root cause analysis and process improvement frameworks
Develop pain point prioritization framework

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what key themes emerged from your analysis? How did you prioritize pain points?
dealReflection.examine: How do you distinguish symptoms from root causes in organizational processes? What psychological factors influence process adherence?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about analytical approaches to organizational problems? How might these skills apply in HR or consulting careers?

activities.description: Compile stakeholder interview summary document
Present findings to Operations Manager
Read: Consulting presentation and client communication
Incorporate feedback and plan recommendation phase

dealReflection.describe: How did you present your findings? What feedback did you receive?
dealReflection.examine: How do you communicate findings that might be sensitive or challenging? What role does trust play in consulting relationships?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about professional client communication? How has this experience built your confidence?

activities.description: Research client onboarding best practices in consulting
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss research findings
Read: Industry benchmarking and best practice adoption
Synthesize research into applicable recommendations

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what best practices did you identify? Which seem most applicable to this organization?
dealReflection.examine: How do you evaluate whether external practices will work in a specific organizational context? What factors affect successful adoption?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about balancing research with practical applicability? How does this connect to evidence-based practice concepts?

activities.description: Develop detailed recommendations with rationale
Review recommendations with Operations Manager
Read: Change management and recommendation implementation
Refine recommendations based on feasibility feedback

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what recommendations did you develop? How did you assess their feasibility?
dealReflection.examine: What organizational factors affect whether recommendations get implemented? How do change management principles apply?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about developing actionable recommendations? How does this differ from academic recommendations?

activities.description: Create prioritized implementation roadmap
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: review roadmap approach
Read: Project planning and implementation metrics
Develop metrics and measurement approach

dealReflection.describe: How did you prioritize recommendations? What criteria did you use for sequencing?
dealReflection.examine: How do organizational readiness and capacity affect implementation planning? What psychological factors influence change adoption?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about planning organizational change? How might these skills apply in organizational consulting or HR roles?

activities.description: Write final recommendations and roadmap document
Review draft with Operations Manager
Read: Consulting deliverable best practices
Refine based on feedback

dealReflection.describe: How did you structure your final deliverable? What makes it actionable for the organization?
dealReflection.examine: What distinguishes a useful consulting deliverable from an academic paper? How do you ensure sustainable impact?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about creating professional deliverables? How does this add to your portfolio?

activities.description: Develop executive presentation of findings and recommendations
Practice presentation and gather feedback
Read: Executive presentation strategies
Refine presentation and prepare for Q&A

dealReflection.describe: How did you design your presentation for an executive audience? What key messages did you emphasize?
dealReflection.examine: How do you adapt your communication for senior leadership? What makes recommendations persuasive at the executive level?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about executive communication? How has this experience prepared you for future professional presentations?

objectives: Reflect on learning and career development

activities.description: Deliver final presentation to leadership team
Debrief with mentor on project and experience
Read: Career paths in organizational consulting and HR
Complete final reflection and project handoff

dealReflection.describe: How did your final presentation go? What questions did leadership ask?
dealReflection.examine: Looking back at the project, how did your understanding of organizational dynamics evolve? What moments were most challenging?
dealReflection.articulate: What are the most valuable skills and insights you gained? How has this experience shaped your career interests in organizational consulting or HR?

assessment.overview: Assessment emphasizes analytical rigor and professional consulting skills through deliverables, a culminating presentation showcasing executive communication, reflective practice demonstrating growth, and employer evaluation of consulting behaviors.

deliverables.description: Tangible artifacts demonstrating consulting competency and ability to analyze and improve organizational processes.

items.name: Current State Process Map
criteria: Clear identification of roles and handoffs

descriptors.exemplary: Captures all process steps with exceptional thoroughness; includes edge cases, exceptions, and process variations that demonstrate deep understanding
descriptors.proficient: Documents all major process steps comprehensively; captures the full workflow accurately
descriptors.developing: Documents main process steps but missing some elements; gaps in coverage
descriptors.beginning: Process documentation incomplete or missing major steps; significant gaps in understanding

descriptors.exemplary: Roles and responsibilities precisely defined; handoffs documented with exceptional clarity including triggers, inputs, and outputs
descriptors.proficient: Roles clearly identified; handoffs well-documented and easy to follow
descriptors.developing: Roles present but some ambiguity; handoffs could be clearer
descriptors.beginning: Roles unclear or missing; handoffs poorly documented or confusing

descriptors.exemplary: Process map is visually exceptional; uses professional notation, clear hierarchy, and design that makes complex process immediately understandable
descriptors.proficient: Process map is clear and professional; visual design supports understanding
descriptors.developing: Process map is readable but visual design could be improved; some clutter or confusion
descriptors.beginning: Process map is difficult to follow; poor visual design impedes understanding

descriptors.exemplary: Demonstrates thorough validation process; incorporates feedback from multiple stakeholders and documents validation approach
descriptors.proficient: Shows evidence of stakeholder validation; accuracy confirmed by relevant parties
descriptors.developing: Some validation evidence but could be more thorough; limited stakeholder input
descriptors.beginning: No evidence of validation; accuracy not confirmed or stakeholders not engaged

descriptors.exemplary: Map reveals insights about process inefficiencies, bottlenecks, or improvement opportunities; demonstrates analytical thinking
descriptors.proficient: Map provides useful foundation for analysis; structure supports identification of issues
descriptors.developing: Map is descriptive but limited analytical value; opportunities not highlighted
descriptors.beginning: Map lacks analytical depth; purely descriptive without supporting further analysis

descriptors.exemplary: Consulting-quality deliverable; exceptional attention to detail, formatting, and overall presentation
descriptors.proficient: Professional quality appropriate for client delivery; well-formatted and polished
descriptors.developing: Approaching professional quality; some formatting or presentation issues
descriptors.beginning: Does not meet professional standards; significant quality issues

presentation.name: Executive Presentation
presentation.description: Communication is a core NACE competency. This culminating presentation demonstrates ability to communicate consulting findings and recommendations to leadership audiences.

reflections.description: Reflections are the key mechanism for learning transfer, helping students connect consulting practice to organizational behavior theory and articulate professional growth.
reflections.schedule: Weekly DEAL reflections submitted each Friday

employerEvaluation.description: Employer feedback validates consulting skills and professional workplace behaviors from the practitioner perspective.

sampleWeek.subtitle: Gathering diverse perspectives on process challenges
objectives: Complete stakeholder interviews across organizational roles
Begin identifying patterns and themes in qualitative data

activities.description: Conduct remaining stakeholder interviews (2-3 interviews)
Bi-weekly mentor check-in: discuss interview insights and emerging patterns
Read: Thematic analysis and qualitative data synthesis techniques

resources.title: How to Do Thematic Analysis: A Step-by-Step Guide
resources.relevance: Systematic approach to coding and analyzing qualitative interview data
resources.personalizationNote: Anna, this provides a structured framework that complements your Research Methods training for analyzing stakeholder interviews.

resources.title: Qualitative Analysis: Coding and Categorizing Data
resources.relevance: Practical demonstration of coding interview data for organizational research
resources.personalizationNote: This shows how to apply the qualitative methods from your coursework to real consulting data.

resources.title: Organizational Psychology Lenses for Process Analysis
resources.relevance: Personalized framework connecting your psychology background to stakeholder interview analysis
resources.personalizationNote: Created specifically for your project based on your coursework in Organizational Behavior and Research Methods
resources.content:
As you analyze stakeholder interview data this week, consider how organizational psychology concepts illuminate the patterns you're finding:

**Role Theory and Perspective Variation**
Different stakeholders experience the same process differently based on their organizational role. Look for how role expectations, status differences, and functional silos shape how people describe pain points. The same bottleneck might be invisible to one role and critical to another.

**Attribution Patterns**
Notice how stakeholders explain process problems. Do they attribute issues to individual behavior, systemic factors, or external constraints? Attribution patterns reveal underlying beliefs about change and responsibility that will affect how recommendations are received.

**Psychological Safety Signals**
Pay attention to what stakeholders seem comfortable sharing versus hesitant to discuss. These signals indicate the organizational culture around feedback and change, which will be crucial for your implementation recommendations.

**Questions for Your Analysis**
- Where do stakeholder narratives converge, and where do they diverge? What explains the differences?
- What emotions accompany different parts of the process (frustration, confusion, resignation)?
- What have stakeholders already tried to improve the process, and why didn't it work?

activities.description: Complete process map and begin coding interview data for themes

dealReflection.describe: Anna, what themes are emerging from your interviews? What patterns do you see across stakeholders?
dealReflection.examine: How do individual perspectives vary based on role and position? What organizational psychology concepts help explain these differences?
dealReflection.articulate: What have you learned about synthesizing diverse stakeholder perspectives? How does this relate to concepts from your coursework?

experientialCompetencies.addressedBy: Authentic consulting work conducting stakeholder interviews and developing process improvement recommendations
Weekly DEAL reflections connecting consulting practice to organizational behavior theory
Connections between Psychology/OB coursework and stakeholder interview analysis and change management
Career-focused reflections exploring consulting and organizational development career paths
